flawed_nl_solution:
Jose has half as many bottles of domestic wine as imported wine, or 2400/2=<<2400/2=1200.0>>1200.0 bottles of domestic wine.
In total, he has 2400+1200.0=<<2400+1200.0=36000.0>>36000.0 bottles of wine.
If the guests drink one-third of all his wine, then they will have consumed 36000.0/3=<<36000.0/3=12000.0>>12000.0 bottles of wine.
Thus, after the party, Jose's private cellar will have 36000.0-12000.0=<<36000.0-12000.0=24000.0>>24000.0 remaining bottles of wine.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 3600.0, not 36000.0. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
